author: andreas
content:
I haven't really thought much about long lenses so far. The 40-150 is extremely light, cheap and quite capable in good light, and at the moment I still have the Sigma 150/2.8 Macro for Nikon with Novoflex adapter, a heavy monster of a lens, but beautifully sharp wide open. I'll sell that though.

I consider getting a used Nikon 180/2.8 AI-S. That would be more or less in the price range of what I can get for the Sigma, but it is designed for manual focus and thus has a longer focus throw. A few months ago I even saw a Canon FD 300/2.8 manual focus lens of extremely high quality for slightly below 1000â‚¬.
